javadoc:
Instances of this class will provide a simple map interface to a cached set of key,value pairs. This class requires that the map can be generated from scratch at any time and that adding/removing items from this map is just a mirroring of those changes elsewhere. This map is lazy in that it won't load the data until needed and it will use a soft reference to maintain the map until such time as the java garbage collector decides to reclaim it.

This class uses a ghidra Lock object to coordinate threaded access when loading the underlying map data. It manages both the lock and its own synchronization to avoid race conditions and deadlocks. @param the key type. @param the value type.

methods.javadoc:
This method will reload the map data from scratch.
@return a map containing all current key, value pairs.
methods.name: loadMap
methods.comment: This method will reload the map data from scratch.

return.comment: a map containing all current key, value pairs.

methods.name: put
methods.comment: Adds the key,value pair to the map.  If the map is not loaded, this method will do nothing.

params.name: value
params.comment: the value that is associated with the key.

methods.name: remove
methods.comment:
Removes the key,value pair from the map as specified by the given key.  If the map is
 currently not loaded, this method will do nothing.

params.name: key
params.comment: the key to remove from the map.

methods.javadoc: Removes any cached map of values and restores the map to its initial state.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Removes any cached map of values and restores the map to its initial state.

methods.name: get
methods.comment:
Retrieves the value for the given key.  This will currently load the map if not already
 loaded.

params.name: key
params.comment: the key for whose value to retrieve.

return.comment: the value for the given key.

methods.name: getMap
methods.comment:
Note: this map is always called from either a synchronized block or code holding the
 "lock".

return.comment: the underlying map of key,value pairs or null if it is currently not loaded.

name: LazyLoadingCachingMap
comment:
Instances of this class will provide a simple map interface to a cached set of key,value
 pairs.  This class requires that the map can be generated from scratch at any time and
 that adding/removing items from this map is just a mirroring of those changes elsewhere.
 This map is lazy in that it won't load the data until needed and it will use a soft reference
 to maintain the map until such time as the java garbage collector decides to reclaim it.
 
 This class uses a ghidra Lock object to coordinate threaded access when loading the
 underlying map data.  It manages both the lock and its own synchronization to avoid
 race conditions and deadlocks.
